Vulnerability.Title: rdma bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux includes a collection of Infiniband and iWARP utilities, libraries and development packages for writing applications that use Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) technology. This update fixes the following bug: With the rdma packages loaded on the system, if the cxgb3, cxgb4 or mlx4 driver was unloaded, then reloaded with modprobe, the provided modprobe.conf files for these drivers did not pass command line arguments if added to the modprobe command. As a consequence, when enabling two Virtual Functions (VFs) in a cxgb3 when modprobe was executed (for example, modprobe cxgb3 num_vf=2), the command-line parameters were not passed through to the module load, and the VFs failed to load. This update adds command-line options to pass through to RDMA modprobe files for the aforementioned drivers, thus fixing this bug. (BZ#1278557) Users of rdma are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note that the RDMA stack is designed to work as a coordinated unit. Users are supposed to update either all or none of the packages. Also, these packages must be used with the kernel packaged with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2. It is not advised to use for example the kernel from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.1 with the rdma packages that are included in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
